content: frankie s knitted stuff christmas cheer fairy lights the first set of decorations for the wreath represents neither festive food nor drink i think a string of brightly coloured fairy lights definitely adds to the christmas cheer through as well as giving a splash of colour amongst the other knitted decorations the colours i used stylecraft special dk 295 m / 100g for my lights - five bright colours and black for the bulb holders lipstick lapis kelly green dandelion magenta the lights are knitted on 3 25 mm / us size 3½ needles and each one is about 4 5 cm / 1¾ long i knitted three lights in each colour giving me a string of 15 fairy lights 1 knitting the lights using one of the colours and the long tail method cast on three stitches row 1 purl row 2 k1 m1 k1 twice 5 sts row 3 purl row 4 k1 m1 k1 x 4 9 sts row 5 purl row 6 k2 m1 k3 twice m1 k1 12 sts now work five row in stocking stitch starting with a purl row next row k2tog x 6 6 sts next row purl change to black yarn for the holder row 1 knit row 2 kb k to end row 3 ssk k2 k2tog 4 sts row 4 purl row 5 ssk k2tog 2 sts cut the yarn and thread through the remaining two stitches twice use the cast on tail of black yarn to join the sides of the holder and darn in that tail leave the cast off tail for now darn in the cast off tail of the coloured yarn and use the cast on tail to oversew / whipstitch part way down the side seam stuff lightly really very lightly or the light won t keep its shape use tweezers to add two tiny balls of stuffing twisting them in and keeping the stuffing in the centre of the light close the rest of the seam and darn in the remaining two yarn tails now you just need to knit fourteen more … 2 when you have knitted all your lights cut a long length of black yarn and sew it to the base of one of the lights then add each of the remaining lights in turn securing them with a few stitches and spacing them about 5 cm / 2 apart sewing the lights to the wreath arrange the lights roughly in place on the wreath pinning them down and re-arranging until the effect is balanced use the green wreath colour to sew each of the lights down through the light holders with a few stitches you can thread the yarn under the wreath cover between the lights my set of rainbow gnomes would like a string of fairy lights for christmas abbreviations st / sts stitch / stitches k knit kb knit into the back of the stitch m1 make 1 by lifting the thread before the next stitch and
